member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Telephony.PhoneMakeCallInfo
member.summary: This structure mimics the PhoneMakeCallInfo structure on the native side.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Telephony.PhoneMakeCallInfo.dwFlags
member.summary: A set of flags indication whether to show the dialog.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Telephony.PhoneMakeCallInfo.ToNativePointer
member.summary: Extracts the contents of the managed structure, and allocates memory for it on the native side.
member.returns: Pointer to the allocated struct on the native side. This must be freed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Telephony.Phone
member.summary: Defines methods for placing phone calls.
member.remarks: If the mobile device is a Pocket PC, then to use this class, it must be the Phone Edition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Telephony.Phone.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Phone class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Telephony.Phone.Talk(System.String)
member.summary: Places the phone call, using the specified string phone number.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Telephony.Phone.Talk(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Places the phone call, using the specified phone number, with a precautionary prompt for verification to proceed (a last chance to make sure you’ve got the right number).
member.param: A bolean value indicating whether to prompt the user, asking for permission to proceed with placing the call.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Telephony.Phone.Call(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Places the phone call, using the specified phone number, with a precautionary prompt for verification to proceed (a last chance to make sure you’ve got the right number).
member.param: A bolean value indicating whether to prompt the user, asking for permission to proceed with placing the call.
